subject: Re: [junit] Printing results from JUnit
msgSnippet: ... Do you *need* to run the graphical version?  Why not run textui and capture the output? Or run it out of Ant, which has very flexible reporting? -- David
messageBody:
Steven Hawkes wrote:
>
> I am using the graphical version of JUnit and was wondering
> if it is possible to get a hardcopy or file based report on
> a test run.
>
> Obviousy for a successful run this is only the number of runs
> but for a failure this would be the list of errors.

Do you *need* to run the graphical version? Why not run textui and
capture the output? Or run it out of Ant, which has very flexible
reporting?
--

David Stagner

National Marrow Donor Program
3001 Broadway Street NE
Broadway Ridge Suite 500
Minneapolis, MN 55413
